intro: Cicer arietinum var. albangulatum, commonly known as the Albanian chickpea, is a variant of the common chickpea native to the Balkan region. It is characterized by its small, round seeds that are typically white or pale yellow in color. This variety is well adapted to temperate climates and thrives in well-drained soils. It is an important crop for local agriculture, valued for its nutritional content and resilience to pests. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with trifoliate leaves and pod-like structures that contain the edible seeds.
